intro: Blepharipappus neomexicanus, commonly known as the New Mexico eyelash flower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, delicate flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. The species is notable for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
